column4: folks, I uninstalled ubuntu-desktop, but now apt-get doesn't want to re-install it anymore. what's the catch?
doesn't want to install it? What's the error?
is that the full output? Could you pastebin the full output?
ok, how did this problem come about, and... what happens if you try to install just xorg?
libmesa-* dependancies
I'm now trying to install libmesa stuff
are you on dapper? And, what do you have in your sources.list?
nope, edgy
you've already upgraded to edgy?
did you dist-upgrade? You really should have the ubuntu-desktop metapackage before upgrading, otherwise you're going to encounter problems.
yeah... I uninstalled ubuntu-desktop a couple of weeks ago after I had upgraded to edgy
and you did a dist-upgrade without having -desktop?
nope, the dist-upgrade was _before_ then, but I think I did a couple of dist-upgrades afterwards (but I don't think that really matters)
it does matter.
have i disrupted the "matrix"?
indeed =). You'll have to play around a lot, and you *may* have mucked up your PM system
Crap.

I think there ought to be more warnings about removing the ubuntu-desktop package if it is going to break something. Atleast, the command-line dist-upgrade should behave like the gui dist-upgrade (ie. exit with a falure)
we warn people all over the place, but hey :)
removing ubuntu-desktop isn't *always* bad, you just always need it with your upgrades
it worked ;-)
rebooting now
